placeholders.title: Upload a GPX file to start
placeholders.description: Set the date, time, and speed, and analyze your route to get a detailed report of weather, terrain, risks, and effort.

sections.adviceCycling: Specific safety recommendations for your bike route.
sections.adviceHiking: Specific safety recommendations for your hiking route.
sections.hazardsDesc: Analysis of the most demanding and dangerous sections of your track.

SetupPage.title: Plan Your Route
SetupPage.noSavedRoutes: You don't have any saved routes yet. Upload a GPX file to get started.
SetupPage.wikilocDescription: Paste the Wikiloc route link to analyze it.
SetupPage.stravaConnectDesc: Connect your Strava account to import your activities and saved routes.
SetupPage.stravaNoActivities: No recent activities with GPS data found.

Hazards.title: Critical Segments
Hazards.noSegments: No risk segments have been detected on this route.

coverage.title: Mobile Coverage
coverage.unavailable: Coverage data is not available at this time. The cell tower service could not be reached.
coverage.hasGaps: Zones with limited or no mobile coverage detected on this route.
coverage.good: Good mobile coverage throughout the route.

Advice.viabilityMsgGo: The weather is on your side. Light winds, dry terrain. Perfect conditions to push your limits.
Advice.viabilityMsgCaution: Viable route, but demanding. Watch out for:
Advice.viabilityMsgDanger: High-risk conditions today. Consider postponing or looking for an alternative valley route.
Advice.title: Route Advice
Advice.waterWarning: Natural springs with low reliability detected. Carry extra water.
Advice.waterOk: Reliable water sources available on route.
Advice.coverageUnavailable: Coverage data is not available at this time. The cell tower service could not be reached.
Advice.coverageGaps: Zones with limited or no mobile coverage detected on this route.
Advice.coverageGood: Good mobile coverage throughout the route.
Advice.escapePointsFound: {count} evacuation point(s) identified along the route.
Advice.escapePointsNone: No evacuation points detected near this route.
Advice.escapePointsTooltipDesc: A location near the route where you can abort, seek help or reach a road. Calculated from OSM data:
Advice.escapePointsTooltipItem1: Villages, towns or hamlets within 2.5 km
Advice.escapePointsTooltipItem2: Primary or secondary roads within 2.5 km
Advice.escapePointsTooltipItem3: Mountain refuges and shelters (alpine_hut / wilderness_hut) within 2.5 km

snow.bootsCycling: Light snow on the trail. Waterproof boots recommended. Bike sections may be unrideable.
snow.bootsWalking: Light snow on the trail. Waterproof boots with good ankle support recommended.
snow.snowshoesCycling: Deep fresh powder snow. The bike is unrideable — snowshoes essential for any walking sections.
snow.snowshoesWalking: Deep fresh powder snow (postholing risk). Snowshoes are essential to avoid sinking knee-deep.
snow.cramponsCycling: Hard packed snow or icy crust detected. The bike is unrideable — crampons or microspikes needed for any walking.
snow.cramponsWalking: Hard packed snow or icy surface detected. Crampons or microspikes are essential. Poles strongly recommended.
snow.mountaineeringCycling: Steep alpine terrain with snow (>30°). Extremely dangerous on a bike. Do not attempt — mountaineering gear required.
snow.mountaineeringWalking: Steep alpine terrain with snow (>30°). Snowshoes are insufficient — crampons and ice axe mandatory.

Advice.mudNone: Dry track expected. No significant mud risk.
Advice.mudLow: Light mud possible on unpaved sections after recent rain.
Advice.mudInfoPrecipDetail: Accumulated precipitation in the 72 hours before the route. Mud forms from past rain, not today's forecast.
Advice.mudInfoSurfaceDetail: Asphalt and rock shed water (0 risk). Clay and bare earth absorb and hold it for days.
Advice.mudInfoDryingDetail: Temperature and wind accelerate evaporation. A warm, windy day dries mud 3× faster than cold and overcast.
Advice.mudInfoSlopeDetail: Flat sections trap standing water. Shaded forest sections dry much more slowly than open terrain.
Advice.mudInfoNote: Scores are estimated from weather data and OSM surface tags. Actual conditions may vary.

cycling.rain: Be careful with curves and wet asphalt. Check your brakes.
cycling.wind: Strong wind detected. Hold the handlebars firmly in exposed areas.
cycling.cold: Use windproof layers. The descent can be freezing.
cycling.night: Front and rear lights mandatory. Reflective vest recommended.
cycling.general: Check tire pressure and carry a repair kit.
cycling.mudMediumCycling: Caution: muddy sections ahead. Reduce speed and avoid hard braking.
cycling.mudHighCycling: Warning: serious mud risk. You may need to carry your bike on some sections.

hiking.rain: Slippery terrain. Use shoes with good grip and a raincoat.
hiking.wind: Avoid exposed ridges if gusts are strong.
hiking.heat: Look for shade and carry at least 2L of water.
hiking.cold: Hypothermia risk if you stop. Carry a thermal blanket.
hiking.night: Headlamp with spare batteries. Do not leave the marked trail.
hiking.general: Inform someone of your route and estimated arrival time.
hiking.mudMediumWalking: Caution: muddy trail sections. Trekking poles and waterproof boots recommended.
hiking.mudHighWalking: Warning: heavy mud on trail. Expect very slow progress and ankle-deep mud.

RouteConfigPanel.adjustDurationDesc: Adjust the duration to automatically recalculate the average speed.

WeatherTimeline.noData: No information available to display at the moment

windEffect.relativeAngle: Relative angle: {angle}° to your travel direction

Auth.loginDescription: Log in to analyze your routes and see detailed weather forecasts.
Auth.stravaDescription: Sync your routes and activities directly.
Auth.terms: By continuing, you agree to our terms of service and privacy policy.
Auth.termsLinks: By continuing, you agree to our <terms>terms of service</terms> and <privacy>privacy policy</privacy>.
Auth.settingsDescription: Configure your preferred units for distance, elevation, temperature, and wind speed.

Privacy.title: Privacy Policy
Privacy.introduction: At zustrack, your privacy is our priority. As a Local-First application, we handle your data differently than traditional web apps.
Privacy.localDataContent: All your route data, GPX files, and settings are stored locally in your browser using PGLite (WASM Postgres) and IndexedDB. We do not have a central database where your tracks are stored.
Privacy.noServerStorageContent: Your sensitive activity data never leaves your device to be stored on our servers. Any analysis (weather, terrain) is performed by sending coordinates to public APIs, but your original tracks are not kept by us.
Privacy.authenticationContent: We use third-party providers (Google, Strava, etc.) only to identify you and allow access to the application. We do not sell or share your profile data with anyone.
Privacy.openSourceContent: zustrack is open source. You can audit our code to verify how your data is handled.

Terms.title: Terms of Service
Terms.acceptance: By using zustrack, you agree to these terms.
Terms.noResponsibilityContent: zustrack is provided 'as is', without any warranty. We are not responsible for any inaccuracies in weather forecasts, terrain data, or any incidents that may occur during your activities.
Terms.userResponsibilityContent: Outdoor activities are inherently risky. Always check multiple sources of information and use your own judgment. The data provided by zustrack is for planning purposes only.
Terms.openSourceContent: The application code is open source. You are free to use it according to its license, but we provide no guarantees regarding its operation.
Terms.dataLossContent: Since data is stored locally in your browser, clearing your browser cache or changing devices will result in the loss of your saved routes unless you have backups.

IBP.title: IBP Index
IBP.description: The IBP index is an automatic scoring system that assesses the difficulty of a route. It is calculated by analyzing distances, elevations, and slopes.

BestWindow.title: Best time to start
BestWindow.description: Click 'Suggest' to analyze the next 12h and find the best weather window.

hero.subtitleBefore: Upload your GPX route or import from Strava. zustrack analyzes weather, terrain and risks
hero.subtitleAfter: — temperature, wind, rain, gradients, mobile coverage and much more.

features.title: Everything you need to know
features.subtitle: A complete analysis of your route before you go. No surprises.
features.weatherDesc: Temperature, wind, rain, visibility and solar index at every kilometer of your route. Not just at the start or destination.
features.elevDesc: See where the hard climbs are before you leave. Automatic coloring by gradient difficulty.
features.hazardsDesc: Automatically identifies demanding climbs, dangerous descents and heat stress sections with risk level.
features.escapeDesc: Towns, main roads and mountain refuges within 2.5 km automatically detected.
features.coverageDesc: Heat map over the route indicating zones with no signal or limited coverage. Real cell tower data.
features.windowDesc: Analyzes the next 12 hours and suggests the best time to leave based on wind, temperature and rain probability.

howItWorks.title: Three steps, zero surprises
howItWorks.step1Desc: Upload a GPX file, import directly from Strava (activities and saved routes) or paste a Wikiloc link.
howItWorks.step2Desc: Choose start date and time, average speed and activity type. zustrack calculates the time at each point.
howItWorks.step3Desc: Get the full report: weather by kilometer, risks, advice, coverage and evacuation points on the map.

import.description: Import from the platforms you already use. zustrack connects with Strava to bring your activities and routes, accepts any GPX and reads Wikiloc routes by just pasting the link.
import.wikilocSub: Import by pasting the route link

cta.subtitle: Join and analyze your next route for free. All you need is a Google or Strava account.
cta.footnote: No credit card · Local data · Open source
